column4: i am having problems with nvidia restricted drivers. everytime i enable them my ubuntu hardy launches in low graphics mode and says my gpu couldn't be detected. anybody?
lspci and dpkg -l |grep nvidia    pastebin the output of those commands
http://pastebin.com/m68eb852b
does my pastebin say something useful?
looks fine
check Xorg.0.log when nvidia drivers are loaded for errors or messages
tho, what ubuntu version do you run? 169.x of nvidia drivers probably don't support 8600 chips
hardy
you used envy to install. no support here
the driver is wrong and not the hardy drivers
envy was my last chance since neither apt-get nvidia-glx-new nor installing the binaries worked
we don't care. envy is not supported end of story. ask the envy folks
which driver version should work?
the one in hardy
works now with the 169.12 drivers...
which commands did you tell me to type in? i forgot (one was lspci and the other one?)
I doN't do envy support. neither does this channel. have a nice day
i'm not talking about envy
you seem to get aggressive as soon as you get confronted with envy. why is this?
it breaks your ubuntu. we cannot support that
it was another factoid, changed now
